item.description: About me: I am a postdoctoral researcher at the VIB-KU Leuven Center for Microbiology, currently studying the functionality of the gut microbiota. During my PhD studies I focused my research on a single bacterium, Mycoplasma pneumoniae. I studied the different mechanisms that this bacterium uses to regulate transcription, from canonical transcription factors to alternative mechanisms such as small RNAs or riboswitches. I analyzed hundreds of datasets from different omics, mostly RNA-seq and ChIP-seq.

item.title: Outreach
item.description: 2021: Outreach article: “Mycoplasma pneumoniae: quan menut no implica simple” in the magazine “Treballs” from the Catalan Society of Biology. This piece summarizes the major findings of my thesis (which granted me the Young Investigator Award of the Society in 2018) in layman’s terms. Link (in catalan) here 2021: International Women’s day (8th of March). Virtual meetings with primary school students (10-11 years old) about my career as a woman doing research in biomedicine.
